item.description:
Let's meet up for another evening of FREE classical music!

The New England Conservatory has a series of FREE symphony orchestra concerts at Jordan Hall each Wednesday night during the school year. The hall is absolutely beautiful, and the acoustics are amazing.

This evening's program is a bit of a departure from our usual Wednesday night fare: The NEC Wind Ensemble will be playing, and the focus will be on music inspired by jazz. Charles Peltz will again be conducting (he conducted the concert 2 weeks ago as well.)

For more details about the concert, go to http://necmusic.edu/n...

The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize a bit before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the left side of center section just past the overhang, but if the balcony is open, I will always try to sit in the left-middle balcony section, since it affords a good view of the orchestra, and any pianist's hands should there be one.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line.

Note: There is currently black canvas covering the entire side of the building and the sidewalk, as I believe the facade is under repair. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street, under the scaffolding.


This evening's program will include:


  • Serenade for Winds by Alec Wilder
  • Stravinsky's Ebony Concerto (composed for Woody Herman)
  • Music from Kurt Weill's Little Three-Penny Opera music
  • Bernard Rands' Ceremonial for winds
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left side of the center section, just past the overhang, or, if it's open, upstairs in the left-middle balcony section.
item.name: Classical Concert Series: NEC Wind Ensemble
